intro: Syngonanthus cowanii var. involucratus, commonly known as the coastal dune everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and is often found growing on sandy soils along the coastline. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate beauty to its habitat. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the plant is well adapted to withstand salt spray and wind. Syngonanthus cowanii var. involucratus is an important component of coastal vegetation, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various small organisms.
